page.title: 12RELIGIOUS FESTIVALS
page.content: The Festival of Eid is celebrated by the Moslems at the end of Ramadan. Ramadan being the time of the year when Moslems fast between the hours of dawn and dusk, for a total of 40 days. Food and drink is only allowed during the hours of darkness and this may mean eating in the middle of the night. This does not apply to very young children. This fast ends with the sighting of the new moon, and this signals the beginning of celebrations. The festival of Eid usually lasts for 2 days and is a time of religious and other celebrations. Eid begins with the Moslems attending the mosque for a prayer meeting. People are dressed in their new clothes, especially the children. After the religious events it is then time for parties, visiting friends and relatives and the giving of presents.
